This service is designed to send emails: This service is designed to send emails using [AWS SES (Simple Email Service)](https://aws.amazon.com/ses/).
Composes an email message and immediatel: Composes an email message and immediately queues it for sending.
You can attach files to emails by provid: You can attach files to emails by providing an array of attachment objects:
Sender email address (uses default if no: Sender email address (uses default if not specified)
Inline template email support was added: Inline template email support was added in [version 1.0.23](./changelog#v1023).
Sends an email using SES v2 Inline Templ: Sends an email using SES v2 Inline Templates. This method supports variable substitution in email templates without requiring pre-registered templates in AWS Console.
Define email templates with variables us: Define email templates with variables using `{{variableName}}` syntax
Automatic variable substitution at send: Automatic variable substitution at send time
Local development support with fallback: Local development support with fallback to manual template compilation
Privacy-safe logging (logs recipient cou: Privacy-safe logging (logs recipient count, not addresses)
You can specify a Configuration Set for: You can specify a Configuration Set for tracking opens and clicks:
Data to inject into template variables: Data to inject into template variables
Configuration set name for open/click tr: Configuration set name for open/click tracking
Plain text body for non-HTML clients: Plain text body for non-HTML clients
When running in offline mode (`IS_OFFLIN: When running in offline mode (`IS_OFFLINE=true`), the service automatically falls back to manual template compilation. This allows testing templated emails without requiring AWS SES connectivity.
